variable.name: Age
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: YKL-40
variable.description: YKL-40 levels measured in frozen serum specimens of subjects who were 6 years of age or older
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: Asthma
variable.description: Presence of both self-reported symptoms (at least two of the following three: cough, wheeze, or shortness of breath) and bronchial hyperresponsiveness (BHR)
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: BHR
variable.description: Bronchial hyperresponsiveness (BHR) is defined as a >=20% decrease in baseline forced expiratory volume in 1 s [FEV1] after inhalation of 25 mg methacholine/ml
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: Atopy
variable.description: Atopy constituted a positive skin-prick test for at least 1 of 14 airborne allergens: house-dust mites (HDM) (Der pteronyssinus and D. farinae), cockroaches (Blattella germanica and Periplaneta americana), molds (Alternaria alternata, Cladosporium herbarum, and Aspergillus fumigatus), pollens (Lolium perenne, Ambrosia artemisifolia, Artemisia vulgaris, Quercus alba, and Betula verrucosa), and animal dander (Felis domesticus and Canis familiaris), as well as negative (saline) and positive (histamine) controls.
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: IgE
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: FEV1
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: FVC
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: FEV1:FVC
variable.description: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second to forced vital capacity ratio
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008

variable.name: FEF
variable.description: Forced expiratory flow between 25% and 75% of the forced vital capacity (FVC)
variable.comment: Please refer to Ober et al., 2008
